attributes.action: Temporary blue badges to be available for those who are incapacitated short term
attributes.background: In 2016 I had foot surgery, I was in plaster cast, followed by a surgical boot. During this time when I was taken to the shops, I was actually more incapacitated than a lot of those who were able to use the disabled parking spaces.
attributes.additional_details: I have contacted West Sussex County Council and my MP in relation to this matter to be told basically that the Blue Badge legislation only currently allows badges to be issued to people with permanent conditions and has a severe impact on their ability to walk and funding.

attributes.action: Condemn the Israeli government killing innocent civilians and unarmed protesters
attributes.background: Condemn the Israeli government for killing innocent people like the 21 year old nurse who was shot dead on 1/06/18 by Israeli soldiers while treating injured Palestinian protesters.
attributes.additional_details:
The death of this nurse cannot go un noticed. This killing must stop and there is more the British government can do to ease matters into peace.  

Targeting medics let alone unarmed protesters is a war crime under the ***Geneva Convention***.

attributes.action: ‘Palm oil’ to be clearly labelled on products containing it, to help consumers.
attributes.background: There are many names for palm oil that consumers won’t recognise. It is not as clear as looking at the ingredients list on a product and searching for palm oil. Some ingredients may be from palm oil but it will not be labelled, e.g. ‘vegetable oil’ in a product may or may not be from palm oil.
attributes.additional_details:
Some names for ingredients that could or do contain palm oil:
INGREDIENTS: Vegetable Oil, Vegetable Fat, Palm Kernel, Palm Kernel Oil, Palm Fruit Oil, Palmate, Palmitate, Palmolein, Glyceryl, Stearate, Stearic Acid, Elaeis Guineensis, Palmitic Acid, Palm Stearine, Palmitoyl Oxostearamide, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide-3, Sodium Laureth Sulfate, Sodium Lauryl Sulfate, Sodium Kernelate, Sodium Palm Kernelate, Sodium Lauryl Lactylate/Sulphate, Hyrated Palm Glycerides, Etyl Palmitate, Octyl Palmitate, Palmityl Alcohol

CONTAINS: Palm oil

attributes.action: Raise awareness about a newly found Genetic Condition EBF3-HADDS
attributes.background:
I am starting this online petition for the UK government to Raise more awareness about this newly found Genetic Condition syndrome called EBF3-HADDS.
This rare mutations in the gene has just recently been found so very little is know. About it. Help us raise more awareness about it please.
attributes.additional_details: https://ebf3blog.wordpress.com

attributes.action: Lower the tax on alcohol sold in pubs and clubs
attributes.background: Once the local pub or club was the centre of a community, people met their future spouses, discussed their problems and received help, made friends and built a network of support encouraging a communal spirit and mental well-being. Cheap alcohol consumption from an off licence fosters non of this.
attributes.additional_details: There is a rising level of mental health issues / youth disorders I believe can be linked to the lose of community spirit. Clubs and pubs can form a focal point of this along side health and fitness centers, recreational clubs and community centers.  The tax on alcohol should be lowered in pubs / clubs to encourage people to get out and socialize rather than consume alcohol at home from off licence premises.

attributes.action: Brexit re article 50 it must not be suspended/stopped under any circumstances
attributes.background: the full details are well known to everyone the media has covered it fully
attributes.additional_details: the british people MUST be given the Brexit they voted for anything else is not acceptable to the british public  ARTICLE 50 must not under any circumstances be hindered/suspended/stopped for any reason whatsoever  the time is here to take action as there has been excessive feet dragging/delaying tactics by those opposed to brexit

attributes.action: Make EV charging as easy as filling up with petrol/diesel fuel.
attributes.background: Make all charging stations accept credit or debit cards or maybe cash with no prior membership. The cost per kWh should also be displayed in the same way as fuel prices are displayed on forecourts. EV uptake will be significantly improved if owners know they can easily charge anywhere.
attributes.additional_details: To charge an EV currently requires one to be a member of a variety of different clubs with different schemes and maybe club cards in order to access charging power points. I usually charge at home but recently tried charging at a charging point but failed. I had installed Polar instants on my phone with credit but either I didn't have mobile data access or the polar servers weren't working but I was unsuccessful. Fortunately I just had enough charge to limp home.

attributes.action: Compulsory mental health education in school.
attributes.background: We need to promote good mental health practices in the same way we promote good physical health.

attributes.action: Make any form of bullying a punishable criminal offence
attributes.background:
As my son is suffering continued bullying and nothing being done . 
And to stop other children being bullied.

attributes.action: Require shops to give workers Boxing Day, New Year’s Day and Easter Sunday off.
attributes.background: It’s so unfair. Whilst area managers, company owners and office staff stay home with their families retail workers HAVE to work! We need time at home with our families too. Where I live there is no public transport on Boxing Day so I’m expected to walk the 4 miles to work and back!!

attributes.action: Revoke Section 74 of the LLA Act 2007 that permits the reuse of graves
attributes.background: Section 74 of the London Local Authorities Act 2007 permits a burial authority to disturb human remains for the purposes of re-using the graves, but Cemeteries are failing to locate people who may have an inherited right. The current procedure is not adequate to identify potential owners of graves.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition calls upon Government to develop new legislation in this field to ensure re-use of graves is only permitted where permission from the grave owner or their relatives, as defined by the regulation, is given.

Graves and memorials provide a tangible link to our past, assist genealogical research but primarily form part of our heritage and encourage acts of Respect and Remembrance, but they are currently being abused.

attributes.action: Revise firearms certificates to allow for wider gun access but harder to obtain
attributes.background: We want to see revisions to Section 1 firearms certificates so that law abiding, mentally healthy citizens have the privilege and freedom to own a wider range of weaponry for the purposes of sports and protection of private property.
attributes.additional_details:
The revisions I am proposing are:
Allow for the sale of semi-automatic, centre-fire rifles to citizens with a section 1 firearms certificate
Allow for the sale of pistols to citizens with a section 1 firearms certificate
Allow for the protection of private property to be a reason for owning a firearm
Reduce the length of firearm certificate to be reduce from 5 to 1 year so mental health and criminal checks happen more often
Change the price of a certificate to make renewal easy but entry hard

attributes.action: A 2nd Brexit referendum should allow 17 year olds on electoral registers to vote
attributes.background: Brexit will affect the UK for generations to come, and in particular the future of our young people.  As with the referendum on Scottish Independence, it is only right therefore that more of them should be given a say.
attributes.additional_details: Ideally such a vote should be extended to all eligible 16 and 17 year olds in the UK, but I recognise that there is unlikely to be enough time to enact this before a second Brexit Referendum, if there is one.  However, electoral rolls should already include the names of 17 year old household occupants.

attributes.action: Making it law that strobe lights can be used for 3-5 seconds only at a time
attributes.background: I have photosensitive epilepsy which restricts MANY things I wish to do. Including flashing bulbs in supermarkets, concerts, theatre, nightclubs, restaurants

attributes.action: If a parent refuses child visitation then maintenance should be non-payable
attributes.background: When a couple separate and the resident-parent still with the children refuses any visitation, then the other non-resident parent should not be held accountable for high child maintenance payments when they want to see the children.
attributes.additional_details: Even if they haven’t got any money, the non-resident parent is still hounded to pay without any visitation rights. The stress caused by these situations is at times unbearable yet any non-paying parent is often seen as a bad parent when that’s not the actual case.

attributes.action: Change in legislation to encourage & support new mums getting back to work.
attributes.background:
PROPOSED LEGISLATION:
1. Mandatory for employers to offer part-time return-to-work up to 3y after birth
2. Give mums returning to work an allowance towards childcare OR:
3. Provide 15h/week subsidised nursery from 1-3 years to cover gap between maternity pay ending and full nursery hours starting
attributes.additional_details: Research has shown that working mums set better examples to their children, and hands-on mums shape more emotionally rounded children. But mums are currently forced to choose between giving up work, not seeing their children, or struggling financially. Becoming a mum is being treated as a punishable offence. To the benefit of creating well-rounded children with strong role models and views of working and earning an income, mums must be supported in being the examples our children need us to be.

attributes.action: Government to urge all countries ban trophy hunting.
attributes.background: I believe the UK Government should put all the pressure it can to make Trophy Hunting illegal worldwide. If we do not do something magnificent creatures will be lost for future generations. I would also like to be illegal to kill a similar creature in Britain.
attributes.additional_details: Trophy hunters are killing 70,000 animals ever year.

attributes.action: Make chain stores responsible for their plastic packaging, i.e extreme fines
attributes.background:
In every shop you visit how many items are packaged in plastic? 

We need to make chain companies responsible for their plastic input to our environment.
attributes.additional_details:
If the Goverment fines: 
• Super Stores/Markets
• Retail Stores
• Warehouses
• Fast food chains
• Delivery companies 
• etc
For the amount of plastic packaging and waste they produce, the UK should see a decline in plastic packaging; in turn this could lessen the companies fines. With the money that it produces this could go towards companies who break down plastics to recycle them, or in to making any plastic waste in to materials to make roads, for example, instead of using asphalt.

attributes.action: Pay student social workers on Placement a minimum wage
attributes.background: Pay a basic living wage to social work students who have to do 37.5 hours on placement. Students should receive a fair wage to help support them during their studies as part time work is not always an option and so money is very tight.
attributes.additional_details: University students who have homes/families and bills to pay struggle to maintain a life on a social work bursary. The placement funding does not cover the miles or the hours driving from one clients house to another over 100 days. Most students rely on family members and friends for handouts and childcare to get through the 20 weeks of unpaid work,doing the same role as social workers on £28,000 a year and up in order to qualify with an MA.

attributes.action: Take back control of disabled persons services and standardised across the UK
attributes.background: There are many differences between counties in the services that are available. This makes it difficult to understand and it shouldn't be down to your postcode as to which services you can access.

attributes.action: Exempt SME's from GDPR or provide tax allowance to offset the cost of compliance
attributes.background: The introduction of GDPR creates compliance and continuing costs to SME's. It is recognised that implementation has already cost billions, disproportionately for SMES. It seriously damages Export and the Service sectors. An appropriate incentive by a tax allowance to offset ongoing costs will assist
attributes.additional_details: US Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross has stated that the “GDPR “significantly interrupts transatlantic co-operation - creates unnecessary barriers to trade for everyone outside the EU". He expressed his "deep concern" about the EU's latest regulatory nightmare warning it will "significantly interrupt transatlantic co-operation, create unnecessary barriers to trade for everyone outside the EU". The costs do and will fall disproportionately on small and medium-sized businesses.

attributes.action: Funding For TMAU Reserach
attributes.background: TMAU is a Odour condition, which due to a genetic disorder in the liver not been able to metolibize food makes people smell of foul odours ; fish, rotten garbage, feces! The smell comes out in breath and sweat! This is not a matter of hygiene, TMAU Suffers can not control it!
attributes.additional_details: TMAU is a condition which is not often talked about in the medical industry due to lack of knowledge! People who suffer are embarrassed and afraid to raise awareness! The suicide rate in the TMAU community is very high and this is a silent killer! There is currently no funding in place to support the research this needs to change with immediate effect! I would like people who are reading this how would you feel waking up every morning smelling of fish and no matter what you do! It will not go !

attributes.action: Abolish the Electoral Commission!
attributes.background: The Electoral Commission is meant to be independent. However we believe it has been partisan in its decision making and they treat some individuals differently to others, particularly over the issue of Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
The reputation of the Electoral Commission has suffered after accusations of political bias in the conduct of its investigations. We believe that it is time to create a new independent body to replace the discredited Electoral Commission. 
 
Abolish the Electoral Commission now!

attributes.action: Allow the public to decide by referendum on any Brexit 'no deal' not Parliament
attributes.background:
The public voted to leave the EU to be better off.
A 'no deal' Brexit will result in the UK being substantially worse off.
The final decision to accept a no deal Brexit  it is so fundamental to the future of the UK that it should be made or rejected by the British people.
attributes.additional_details:
The referendum will allow the public the opportunity to take the decision for the UK based the facts of a no deal.
A no deal Brexit has profound implications for the future way of life for the people of the United Kingdom.
The confidence held by the UK in its members of Parliament will be enhanced by being allowed to take this final decision by referendum. Equally, should Parliament take the decision the potential public anger at being worse off could cause public unrest and further division.

attributes.action: To keep the RAF Red Arrows in Lincolnshire after RAF Scampton closes.
attributes.background: The Red Arrows have been in lincoln for years . It's there home and alot of people would agree they should stay in lincoln as that is one of the know facts of lincoln .

attributes.action: Ban animal glue traps
attributes.background:
Glue traps are used as a method of trapping animals however this results in an agonising, slow and painful death for the creature who has sadly been caught. 
Commonly these traps are often laid down to catch vermin however many animals such as Endangered rodents, lizards and even birds are trapped.
attributes.additional_details: Many companies thought America have already banned the sale of these awful death traps.

attributes.action: Give equal child related financial support to all families,not just "low income"
attributes.background: "Low income"families receive an abundance of financial help when they have a child.Tax credits/Maternity grants/benefits/free nursey places etc.With such low maternity pay slashing working household income I believe that all families with young children should receive the same financial help.
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the support available for "low income" families.

Maternity grants
Child tax credits
Healthy start scheme
Housing benefit
Free nursery from a younger age than those who are not low income.
Council tax reduction
Etc etc

If you fall above the threshold and receive no help, you can end up worse off than those "low income families" and working harder for it too.

All babies/children deserve the same start/support from our government. We pay into the system, so support us when we need it.

attributes.action: New powers to take over failing schools
attributes.background: Government and local authorities need powers to take over failing schools. After the notification in March this year to close Plymouth Studio School, it was acknowledged that the secondary school system in Plymouth is failing our children. The Government must intervene.
attributes.additional_details: Six months on and into a new school year, the children from Studio School have been forgotten and the standards of our Plymouth Secondary Schools are well below the national average. Exam results are well below what they should be and although MPs have spoken out, I can see no action or improvements. The promises made to the Studio School children haven’t been upheld and they have been swept under the carpet. The current system is failing our children. The Government must accept responsibility.

attributes.action: Allow pupils to opt out of music lessons on religious grounds
attributes.background: Some muslims believe Islam forbids them to play musical instruments, listen to music, dance and can not play a role in it. As this subject is compulsory on the National Curriculum, some muslims are being forced to go against their religion by schools.
attributes.additional_details:
As parents we have full right over what information is delivered to our children. Muslims should not have to compromise with anyone on what they believe to be clear cut orders and principles conveyed in their religion. So therefore the subject music should be optional. Evidence from the Holy Book (Quran), Allah SWT, says in Surah Luqman, "And of the people is he who buys the amusement of speech [music] to mislead [others] from the way of Allah will have a humiliating
punishment". [Luqman 31:6]

attributes.action: Reform Private Member's Bill procedure so that an objection needs to be seconded
attributes.background: Evidenced today; Friday 15th June 2018, a Private Members Bill was objected to by a lone MP. The Private Members Bill process allows for Bills to be introduced by MPs and Lords who are not government ministers, furthering the democratic process. The objection by one MP hinders that process.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is to request that parliamentary procedures be modernised. When an opportunity arises where an MP may object to a reading of a Private Bill or Private Member Bill, any objection must be seconded by another MP for it to be recognised. This change will allow for the democratic process to represent the electorate without it being compromised by a lone voice.

attributes.action: Issue an official apology to Lauren Southern for denial of entry into the UK
attributes.background:
Lauren Southern was detained in Calais by Kent police and charged under section 7 of the terrorism act, before being denied entry into the UK.

The Government must apologise for this.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that that section 7 was wrongfully applied as Section 41 states that "A constable may arrest without a warrant a person whom he reasonably suspects to be a terrorist." I do not believe that the police believed Lauren Southern to be a terrorist.

attributes.action: Make asthma prescriptions free of charge as this is a chronic lifetime condition
attributes.background: Several other chronic conditions e.g. diabetes, hypothyroidism, get free prescriptions. I am not asking for all their medication to be free just those required to keep asthma under control.

attributes.action: License Push Bikes
attributes.background:
Who has had enough of being left with the repair costs, when involved in an accident with a push bike? 
Personally I am sick of being left at the roadside after a bike has hit my vehicle and then fled the scene.
attributes.additional_details:
The Motor Car Act 1903, required all motor vehicles to be entered on an official vehicle register, and to carry alphanumeric plates. The Act was passed in order that vehicles could be easily traced in the event of an accident or contravention of the law. 
It’s seem evidently obvious that this should apply to push bike, so they can be held accountable for their actions.
Let all get together and make a difference, sign this petition and let’s get our voice heard.

attributes.action: Change Child Benefit cap from £60k sole earner to £100k joint or single income
attributes.background: The rules introduced in 2012 that child benefit should be capped at £60,000 are fundementally flawed. A single income of £60,000 means that you are not entitled to any child benefit yet 2 parents working can earn £98,000 and get the full entitlement.
attributes.additional_details: A single earner of £60k will be on a 40% tax bracket with no child benefit yet 2 parents can earn £43k each at 20% and get full child benefit. Families work extremely hard to enable one of the parents to look after their children during their youngest years rather than a stranger but the government seems to want to make this extremely difficult. There is also very little public Information to inform you that you lose this when you hit £60k meaning you end up in debt to the inland revenue.

attributes.action: Make calls to the Police non-emergency number 101 free.
attributes.background: Calls to 999 are free, but often these are not urgent. Calls to the NHS 111 are free. The public are encouraged (quite rightly) to report crimes, but are discouraged by the cost. If the Police want the public to report more crimes, and to reduce non-urgent 999 calls, 101 should be a free service.

attributes.action: State categorically that Canada has our support in its spat with Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: At a time when Britain is leaving the EU and restrengthening our links with our Commonwealth friends, why have we turned our back on Canada during their assault by Saudi Arabia? We share a monarchy and history, so an attack on Canada is also an attack on us and our way of life.
attributes.additional_details: We should back Canada fully against Saudi Arabia and show them that they are not alone in standing up for human rights in the world. Cowardice and arms sales should never come before long term friends and relations. Many of us have family members in Canada and our history goes back all the way. How embarrassing that our government has put money before pride, morality and friends.

attributes.action: After Brexit - Expats spouses should be allowed to live in the UK without a visa
attributes.background: After the Brexit, British expats should be able to bring our partners/wifes/husbands who are not British to live in the UK without a visa (as in the past being in Europe).
attributes.additional_details: With the current deal for Brexit, if you want to move back, we can get passports for our children but not our wifes or husbands. Our wifes and husbands should be given freedom of movement as our children do. We are families, we shouldn’t be split apart.

attributes.action: Legislate to ensure all future England football matches are 'free to air'
attributes.background:
The excitement, drama, joy & pain of being an England supporter has been made so evident to a new generation. 

We should encourage those fans to hold their interest in the wonderful game and allow TV licence paid access for all of them and us diehards too. 

No satellite/cable//other fee needed
attributes.additional_details:
Euro 2020 Final is at Wembley on 12th July 2020.

Let us be there all the way.

It's coming home!

This wiki about OfCom, the Broadcasting Act 1996 & subsequent Regulations shows only that only the finals for Euro 2020 are covered and that all other qualifying matches/friendlies will be pay per view or subscription. 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ofcom_Code_on_Sports_and_Other_Listed_and_Designated_Events

attributes.action: Law change. No reduced sentence if plea changed after further evidence heard.
attributes.background: For victims reliving evidence can be very traumatic and then seeing the offender getting a reduced sentence is adding more pain. For example, abused children may see the sex offender get shorter sentences as they have pleaded guilty when the child discloses more information about the offence.
attributes.additional_details: There should be no reduction in sentence for a guilty plea made after the victim has given evidence.

attributes.action: Confirmed date for National Rollout of voluntary right to buy
attributes.background: There have been numerous regional trials for the VRTB which have all been used to stall a national roll out of the scheme. Our voices are ignored, all question go unanswered. It's time we were given the same rights as council tenants as promised in the Government's 2015 manifesto.

attributes.action: Add March 29th to the occasions fireworks are allowed until 1AM
attributes.background: Brexit day must rank at least as high as New Year’s Eve for a celebration.

attributes.action: Encourage Overseas Territories to ensure the rights of LGBT+ people
attributes.background: In almost all, if not all of the British Overseas Territories, LGBT+ residents do not enjoy the same rights LGBT+ people enjoy in mainland Great Britain. While some BOT residents enjoy equal marriage, others have no protection from discrimination, like we have in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Additionally, transgender identity is not legally recognised in many of our territories. Laws, such as the Gender Recognition Act 2004 and the Equality Act 2010, should be implemented to reflect the values of the UK. If the UK cannot implement these laws, then our government should encourage the territories to conform. Many territories are military bases. The British Military prides itself on openness, diversity and inclusion, so why can't the territories they serve do so too?

attributes.action: Create a voluntary, opt-in, monthly payment that goes 100% to the NHS
attributes.background: Recently, my 2 year old daughter has been suffering from a health condition that we are still looking into. Without the NHS, the treatment my daughter has received and is still yet to receive would have cost me tens of thousands of pounds that I simply could not afford. We all depend on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, the taxes we pay are used to fund numerous different categories including international services, culture and religion to name a few as well as the NHS. All of this information can be found on the .gov website. This proposal would be an additional, voluntary payment that would go solely to fund the NHS.
 
As members of the public, we are quick enough to comment that the NHS needs more funding and investment, this option would put the ball in our court. Something needs to change.

attributes.action: Make gay conversion therapy a criminal offence
attributes.background:
Gay conversion therapy is currently legal in the UK

No one should be told that their sexual orientation, their identity, is a an illness that needs to be cured.
attributes.additional_details:
Following a journalist's report on gay conversion therapy at a church in Liverpool the government has devised a 75 point action plan to improve the lives of the LGBT community. The plan states that the government will set out to ban such therapies but doesn't say how this is going to be enforced.

You can't simply just tell people not to do something and hope that it works, because it doesn't. Something more needs to be done. We urge the government to criminalise gay conversion therapy.

attributes.action: To stop companies selling debts to debt collection companies
attributes.background: Want it so companies eg mobile phone companies can’t sell a debt on to debt companies who then add extortionate charges and use heavy handed tactics. The contract is between the company and the person who takes out the contract, making that contract a legal document.

attributes.action: Provide training to all NHS GP's and Health Visitors on the baby and child sleep
attributes.background: To provide all NHS GP's and Health visitors with an accurate basic knowledge on baby and child sleep. Sleep deprivation is one of the biggest causes of mental health problems in parents and the advice given is very mixed, inaccurate and could cause families more harm.
attributes.additional_details:
GP's and Health Visitors all seem to have different ideas on baby and child sleep. This ranges from:
How much sleep they should have,
When they should wake from their last nap,
Starting solids to get babies to sleep,
Using Piriton (drugging them),
Letting them cry themselves to sleep,
Assuming all babies and children will just fall asleep when they are tired,
Cutting naps from already sleep deprived infants,
Yes, I have heard all of these. Science and research needs to be taken into account now.

attributes.action: Stop sanctioning benefit claimants by withdrawing access to money.
attributes.background:
No one in the UK should be left without access to benefits. Sanctions  lead to further poverty which can include loss of homes and sometimes to death.
Losing benefits is not a proportionate response to missed appointments. No one should be denied access to money.
It is time for sanctions to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/one-in-five-benefit-related-deaths-involved-sanctions-admits-dwp/

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2015/aug/27/death-britains-benefits-system-fit-for-work-safety-net

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/benefits-sanction-resulted-in-my-brother-david-clapson-s-death-says-gill-thompson-as-she-pleads-for-a6911386.html

https://edition.cnn.com/2018/11/05/uk/uk-austerity-un-rapporteur-intl/index.html

attributes.action: Introduce heavy taxation on palm oil so businesses remove it from their products
attributes.background: We lose 25 orangutans per day, largely due to the palm oil industry which requires the burning of trees such as the oil palm, which is their natural habitat. The government should heavily tax palm oil so businesses are discouraged from using it in their products and find other, better alternatives.
attributes.additional_details: Iceland state that they're removing palm oil from all of their own label products which shows that it is more than possible for businesses to do and to follow suit. Therefore, I am calling for heavy taxation on palm oil so it is not financially viable for businesses to use it, and therefore they find a less damaging and more ethical alternative.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to own a cat over the age of 6 months that isn't microchipped
attributes.background: To see a dog roaming on its own causes concern, yet a cat on the streets doesn't? Cats are provided freedom by their owners but can, like anyone get lost, so surely we should have greater protection over them as it became a requirement in 2016 for dogs to be chipped. They're family too and loved.
attributes.additional_details: I helped my neighhour rehome his cats due to illness and provided the family who took them with paperwork, advice and medication (regular flea and worming treatment). Only to find out months later they were found under a shed, near starved and miles away from our home. Many facebook posts of injured or dead cats receive less shares than those of dogs. Owners of cats love their pets equally and it's about time that society recognises this despite their preferences of a pet and family member.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for people living with heart conditions
attributes.background: Coronary heart disease remains the number 1 killer in the UK. Every 7 minutes someone in the UK will have a heart attack and 800,000 people are living with heart failure every year. Despite this heart patients still have to pay for medication which is not affordable for everyone.
